gt_metadata.note: Freeform Stacking: Leah reviews entire document including CP redlines. Representing party is SAME as Freeform Baseline.

part_a_cp_redlines.original_text: Distributor shall purchase Products at the prices set forth in Supplier's then-current price list. Supplier may modify prices upon sixty (60) days' prior written notice.
part_a_cp_redlines.cp_redline: Distributor shall purchase Products at the prices set forth in Supplier's then-current price list. Supplier may modify prices upon fifteen (15) days' prior written notice, and such changes shall apply retroactively to purchase orders placed but not yet fulfilled.
part_a_cp_redlines.example_revision: Distributor shall purchase Products at the prices set forth in Supplier's then-current price list. Supplier may modify prices upon sixty (60) days' prior written notice.
key_elements: 1) 60-day notice period retained 2) No retroactive price changes 3) Changes apply only to future orders
acceptable_variations: May extend to 90 days with price cap (CPI + 3%)
May add termination right if price increase exceeds 10%
May clarify: changes apply only to orders placed after effective date
unacceptable_responses: Price changes applying to accepted orders
part_a_cp_redlines.reasoning_must_address: 15 days insufficient for planning; retroactive changes violate pipeline protection; Distributor needs time to adjust customer pricing; 60 days is market standard

part_a_cp_redlines.original_text: Distributor agrees to purchase a minimum of One Hundred Thousand Dollars ($100,000) of Products per calendar quarter during the Term of this Agreement. Failure to meet minimum purchase requirements for two (2) consecutive quarters shall constitute a material breach.
part_a_cp_redlines.cp_redline: Distributor agrees to purchase a minimum of Two Hundred Fifty Thousand Dollars ($250,000) of Products per calendar quarter during the Term of this Agreement, with an automatic ten percent (10%) annual escalator. Failure to meet minimum purchase requirements for one (1) quarter shall constitute a material breach.
part_a_cp_redlines.example_revision: Distributor agrees to purchase a minimum of One Hundred Thousand Dollars ($100,000) of Products per calendar quarter during the Term of this Agreement. Failure to meet minimum purchase requirements for two (2) consecutive quarters shall constitute a material breach.
key_elements: 1) Minimum remains at $100K/quarter 2) No automatic escalator 3) Two consecutive quarter grace period before breach
acceptable_variations: May accept modest increase if justified by territory ($125K-$150K)
May add ramp-up period for new products
May add cure period (60 days) before breach declared
unacceptable_responses: One quarter miss = breach (no grace period)
Minimums exceeding $150K without corresponding rights increase
part_a_cp_redlines.reasoning_must_address: 2.5x increase plus escalator creates unsustainable commitment; one-quarter breach eliminates flexibility; automatic escalators compound exposure; no justification for increase

part_a_cp_redlines.original_text: Supplier hereby appoints Distributor as a non-exclusive distributor of the Products within the Territory.
part_a_cp_redlines.cp_redline: Supplier hereby appoints Distributor as a non-exclusive distributor of the Products within the Territory. Distributor agrees not to distribute, market, or sell any products that compete with the Products during the Term and for two (2) years thereafter.
part_a_cp_redlines.example_revision: Supplier hereby appoints Distributor as a non-exclusive distributor of the Products within the Territory.
key_elements: 1) Non-exclusive appointment without non-compete 2) Distributor retains right to carry competing products 3) No post-term restrictions
acceptable_variations: If adding non-compete: must convert to exclusive territory
If adding non-compete: must be narrow (specific products only)
May accept limited during-term non-compete if exclusive granted
part_a_cp_redlines.reasoning_must_address: Non-compete with non-exclusive is one-sided; Distributor needs portfolio diversification; Supplier retains right to compete directly; post-term restriction blocks business development

part_a_cp_redlines.original_text: This Agreement shall have an initial term of three (3) years from the Effective Date. Thereafter, it shall automatically renew for successive one (1) year periods unless either Party provides ninety (90) days' notice of non-renewal prior to the expiration.
part_a_cp_redlines.cp_redline: This Agreement shall have an initial term of one (1) year from the Effective Date. Thereafter, it shall automatically renew for successive one (1) year periods unless either Party provides ninety (90) days' notice of non-renewal prior to the expiration. Supplier may terminate this Agreement for convenience upon sixty (60) days' written notice at any time.
part_a_cp_redlines.example_revision: This Agreement shall have an initial term of three (3) years from the Effective Date. Thereafter, it shall automatically renew for successive one (1) year periods unless either Party provides ninety (90) days' notice of non-renewal prior to the expiration.
key_elements: 1) Three-year initial term 2) No unilateral Supplier termination for convenience 3) Symmetric renewal/termination rights
acceptable_variations: May accept 2-year initial if market investment is lower
May add mutual termination for convenience with notice
May add performance-based early exit (if minimums not met)
part_a_cp_redlines.reasoning_must_address: 1-year term insufficient to recover market investment; unilateral Supplier termination eliminates Distributor certainty; 3-year term is standard for territory development; asymmetry creates one-sided risk

part_b_whole_document.note: Part B uses the Freeform Baseline GT. Same contract, same issues. Evaluate whether Leah still detects these risks when CP redlines are present.

part_c_document_quality.scope: Every redline Leah produces in the output .docx

per_redline_capture.linked_gt_id: GT ID if NEW_REDLINE addresses Part B issue, else null
per_redline_capture.action_executed: ACCEPT | MODIFY | REJECT | ADD | DELETE | NONE
per_redline_capture.insertion_accuracy: 0-2 | NA (aligned pair average, NA for DELETE/simple swaps)

aggregation_rules.quality_fields: Averaged across evaluations; median used for divergent scores
